intro: Syngonanthus heteropeplus, commonly known as the variable grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. The plant features slender, erect stems with alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in racemes and are followed by legume-like pods that contain several seeds. Syngonanthus heteropeplus is characterized by its variable morphology, which contributes to its common name.
